channel.title: unpublished on Blake Bronson-Bartlett
channel.description: Recent content in unpublished on Blake Bronson-Bartlett

item.title: Conferences
item.description: Conferences Talks “The Pencil’s Progress: A Defense of Messy Handwriting.” Day at Dumbarton (The National Society of the Colonial Dames of America/Dumbarton House, Washington, D.C.), Virtual, April 28, 2022. Delivered Papers “The Wild Traces of Calaveras County in Notebook IV.” The 8th Annual Quarry Farm Symposium: Mark Twain and the West, Elmira, NY, October 1-3, 2020. “Graphite’s Dirty Truth: The Pencil in Whitman’s New York Poetry.” International Whitman Week 2019, Walt Whitman & New York Symposium, The Grolier Club, June 1, 2019.

item.title: Digital Projects
item.description: Digital Projects "Mabbott Poe: A Digital Resource for the Study of Edgar Allan Poe and the Editing of his Collected Writings by Thomas Ollive Mabbott."

item.title: Publications
item.description: Publications Book Chapters “Graphite Time.” Handwriting in Early America: A Media History. Ed. Mark Alan Mattes. Amherst: University of Massachusetts Press (in press). Peer-reviewed Academic Articles "The California and Hawaii Notebooks: Pencils, Pocket Notebooks, and the Messiness of Mark Twain." Mark Twain Annual 20 (2022). "The Mysterious Stranger’s Crisis of Duplicates: Incompletion and the Vexed Transmission of Twain's Late Writings." Mark Twain Annual 18 (2020). “Writing with Pencils in the Antebellum U.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching Visiting Assistant Professor, University of Iowa, Iowa City, IA, 2016-2019. Breaking Form/Making Books: Literary Experimentation in the US after 1800, University of Iowa, Iowa City, IA, Visiting Assistant Professor, 2019, 1 section. This course consisted of three five-week units based on the study of single authors who were considered innovators in their own time: Walt Whitman, Langston Hughes, and Ronald Johnson. Each unit began with a session working with rare editions of the authors’ works in the university’s special collections.

item.title: Translations
item.description: Translations With Robert Fernandez. Morisseau-Leroy, Félix. Antigòn (excerpt). Intranslation. September 2017.. Stingelin, Martin. “‘Writing’: An Introduction.” In “I am disgusted with this century of scribblers”: Writing Scenes in the Age of Manuscript” [“‘Schreiben’: Einleitung.” In “Mir ekelt vor diesem tintenklecksenden Säkulum”: Schreibszenen im Zeitalter der Manuskripte]. Ed. Martin Stingelin. Munich: Wilhelm Fink. 7-21. PDF Mallarmé, Stéphane. Azure: Poems and Selections from the “Livre.” With Robert Fernandez. Middletown, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2015.
